label: Behavior 47631877
summary: Vessel behavior pattern: following a curved maritime route (the persistent small differences between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and gradual course evolution, suggest the vessel is navigating a predefined curved channel or coastal bend; position progression follows an approximately linear trajectory in geographic coordinates with slight northeasterly curvature, modeled by a second-order polynomial: latitude ≈ 54.31 + 0.00012 × t + 0.000003 × t², longitude ≈ 9.71 + 0.00018 × t + 0.000006 × t², where t is sequential time index)
description: Speed profile: stable (the vessel maintains a consistent speed between 6.2 and 7.0 knots across multiple observations, indicating steady propulsion)
Course change: gradual and consistent (COG changes slowly and monotonically over time, e.g., from 7.8° to 49.0° then to 118.9°, reflecting a smooth turn rather than abrupt maneuvers)
Heading fluctuation: stable (heading values remain closely aligned with COG, with small deviations under 3°, suggesting no erratic rudder movements)

Behavior intent: following a curved maritime route (the persistent small differences between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and gradual course evolution, suggest the vessel is navigating a predefined curved channel or coastal bend; position progression follows an approximately linear trajectory in geographic coordinates with slight northeasterly curvature, modeled by a second-order polynomial: latitude ≈ 54.31 + 0.00012 × t + 0.000003 × t², longitude ≈ 9.71 + 0.00018 × t + 0.000006 × t², where t is sequential time index)
